intro: Cofeanthus ebracteolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved coffee plant, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many coffee species. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that contain two seeds, which are used to make coffee. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
